docs.snippet: England has disappointed its fans since winning the World Cup in 1966, and the national pessimism was confirmed in a loss to Italy in their first match.
docs.lead_paragraph: England has disappointed its fans since winning the World Cup in 1966, and the national pessimism was confirmed in a loss to Italy in their first match.
docs.abstract: Italy beats England, 2-1, in first round of their World Cup group stage.

headline.seo: World Cup 2014: England Has Disappointed Since 1966 Win
headline.main: Carrying Fragile Hopes, England Stumbles in Opener
headline.print_headline: Carrying Fragile Hopes, England Stumbles in Opener

docs.snippet: With Uruguay’s star striker Luis Suárez on the bench, Costa Rica began Group D play with a major upset, scoring three goals in the second half.
docs.lead_paragraph: With Uruguay’s star striker Luis Suárez on the bench, Costa Rica began Group D play with a major upset, scoring three goals in the second half.
docs.abstract: World Cup Roundup; Costa Rica comes from behind to stun Uruguay, 3-1, in opening play in the World Cup’s tough Group D with a major upset.

headline.main: World Cup 2014: Costa Rica Rallies to Stun Uruguay
headline.print_headline: World Cup: Costa Rica Rallies to Stun Uruguay

docs.snippet: Supporting Uruguay seems to be a mix of masochism and nostalgia, and the country’s 3-1 loss to Costa Rica on Saturday will reinforce its fans’ cultured skepticism.
docs.lead_paragraph: Supporting Uruguay seems to be a mix of masochism and nostalgia, and the country’s 3-1 loss to Costa Rica on Saturday will reinforce its fans’ cultured skepticism.
docs.abstract: World Cup Postcard; Uruguay won the inaugural World Cup in 1930; today, supporting Uruguay seems to be a mix of masochism and nostalgia, and the country’s 3-1 loss to Costa Rica reinforces its fans’ cultured skepticism.

headline.seo: After Loss to Costa Rica, Uruguay Reexamines Itself
headline.main: A Nation Teased by a Stale Promise of Supremacy
headline.print_headline: A Nation Teased by a Stale Promise of Supremacy

docs.snippet: England's stalwarts couldn't match the pace of guile of the team's young lions in Saturday’s 2-1 Group D defeat by Italy, raising questions about whether players such as captain Steven Gerrard and Wayne Rooney should still be automatic...
docs.lead_paragraph: England's stalwarts couldn't match the pace of guile of the team's young lions in Saturday’s 2-1 Group D defeat by Italy, raising questions about whether players such as captain Steven Gerrard and Wayne Rooney should still be automatic starters.

headline.main: Crunch Time Beckons for England as Stalwarts Falter
headline.print_headline: Crunch Time Beckons for England as Stalwarts Falter

docs.snippet: Italy can't afford to celebrate too much after opening the World Cup with an impressive win over England.

headline.main: Italy Has No Time to Celebrate After England Win
headline.print_headline: Italy Has No Time to Celebrate After England Win

docs.snippet: A YouTube video showing a young slip of a lad scything through the heart of defenses with devastating pace and the balance of a tightrope walker had Liverpool fans tapping at their keyboards in a flurry of excitement.
